create.title: Create a ServiceAccount
create.description: Specifies whether a ServiceAccount should be created

name.title: The name of the ServiceAccount
name.description: The name of the ServiceAccount to use. If not set and create is true, a name is derived using the release and chart names

create.title: Create K10 SSC
create.description: Whether to create a SecurityContextConstraints for K10 ServiceAccounts

allowCSI.title: SCC allow CSI as volume type
allowCSI.description: Enable/disable the CSI ephemeral volumes in k10

create.title: Create NetworkPolicies
create.description: Whether to create NetworkPolicies for the K10 services

pullPolicy.title: Container images pullPolicy
pullPolicy.description: Change default pullPolicy for all the images

repository.title: helm repository
repository.description: The helm repository for offline (airgapped) installation

persistence.title: Persistent Volume global details
persistence.description: Configure global settings for Persistent Volume

mountPath.title: Persistent Volume global mount path
mountPath.description: Change default path for Persistent Volume mount

enabled.title: Enable Persistent Volume
enabled.description: Create Persistent Volumes

storageClass.title: Persistent Volume global Storageclass
storageClass.description: If set to '-', dynamic provisioning is disabled. If undefined (the default) or set to null, the default provisioner is used. (e.g gp2 on AWS, standard on GKE, AWS & OpenStack)

accessMode.title: Persistent Volume global AccessMode
accessMode.description: Change default AccessMode for Persistent Volumes

size.title: Persistent Volume size
size.description: Change default size for Persistent Volumes

metering.title: Metering service Persistent Volume details
metering.description: Configure Persistence Volume for metering service

size.title: Metering service Persistent Volume size
size.description: If not set, global.persistence.size is used

catalog.title: Catalog service Persistent Volume details
catalog.description: Configure Persistence Volume for catalog service

size.title: Catalog service Persistent Volume size
size.description: If not set, global.persistence.size is used.

jobs.title: Jobs service Persistent Volume details
jobs.description: Configure Persistence Volume for jobs service

size.title: Jobs service Persistent Volume size
size.description: If not set, global.persistence.size is used.

logging.title: Logging service Persistent Volume details
logging.description: Configure Persistence Volume for logging service

size.title: Logging service Persistent Volume size
size.description: If not set, global.persistence.size is used.

podLabels.title: Deprecated: Custom labels to be set to all Kasten Pods
podLabels.description: Deprecated: Configures custom Pod labels to be set to all Kasten Pods. Use `global.resourceLabels` and `global.ephemeralResourceLabels` instead.

podAnnotations.title: Custom annotations to be set to all Kasten Pods
podAnnotations.description: Configures custom Pod annotations to be set to all Kasten Pods.

resourceLabels.title: Custom labels to be set to all Kasten resources
resourceLabels.description: Configures custom resource labels to be set to all Kasten resources.

ephemeralResourceLabels.title: Custom ephemeral labels to be set to all Kasten ephemeral resources
ephemeralResourceLabels.description: Configures custom ephemeral labels to be set to all ephemeral Kasten resources.

rhMarketPlace.title: RedHat marketplace config
rhMarketPlace.description: Set it to true while generating helm operator

resources.title: Global resource settings
resources.description: Global resource quota to be added to each Kasten service unless overridden by service specific values

requests.title: Global resource requests
requests.description: Global resource requests to be added to each Kasten service unless overridden by service specific values

limits.title: Global resource limits
limits.description: Global resource limits to be added to each Kasten service unless overridden by service specific values

aggregatedapis.description: Used for packaging RedHat Operator. Setting this flag along with global.rhMarketPlace=true overrides the default image name. This flag is only for internal purposes. annotations.description: Add optional annotations to the Ingress resource

create.title: Expose dashboard via ingress
create.description: whether the K10 dashboard should be exposed via ingress

enabled.title: Enable TLS
enabled.description: Configures a TLS use for ingress.host

secretName.title: Optional TLS secret name
secretName.description: Specifies the name of the secret to configure ingress.tls[].secretName

name.title: Ingress name
name.description: Optional name of the Ingress object for the K10 dashboard.

class.title: Ingress controller class
class.description: Cluster ingress controller class: nginx, GCE

pathType.title: Ingress path type
pathType.description: Set the path type for the ingress resource

defaultBackend.title: Ingress default backend
defaultBackend.description: Optional default backend for the Ingress object.

service.title: Ingress default backend service
service.description: A service referenced by the default backend (mutually exclusive with `resource`).

enabled.title: Enable service default backend.
enabled.description: Enable the default backend backed by a service.

name.title: Service name
name.description: Name of a service referenced by the default backend.

port.title: Service port
port.description: A port of a service referenced by the default backend.

name.title: Port name
name.description: Port name of a service referenced by the default backend (mutually exclusive with `number`).

number.title: Port number
number.description: Port number of a service referenced by the default backend (mutually exclusive with `name`).

resource.title: Ingress default backend resource
resource.description: A resource referenced by the default backend (mutually exclusive with `service`).

enabled.title: Enable resource default backend.
enabled.description: Enable the default backend backed by a resource.

apiGroup.title: Resource API group
apiGroup.description: Optional API group of a resource referenced by the default backend.

kind.title: Resource kind
kind.description: Type of a resource referenced by the default backend.

name.title: Resource name
name.description: Name of a resource referenced by the default backend.

accept.title: Enable accept EULA before installation
accept.description: An End-User license agreement (EULA) is a legal agreement that grants a user a license to use an application or software. Users must consent to the EULA before purchasing, installing, or downloading an application or software owned by the service provider.

license.title: License from Kasten
license.description: Add license string obtained from Kasten

domainName.title: Domain name of the cluster
domainName.description: Set domain name of the cluster

enabled.title: Enable the multi-cluster system
enabled.description: Choose whether to enable the multi-cluster system components and capabilities

create.title: Setup cluster as a multi-cluster primary
create.description: Choose whether to setup cluster as a multi-cluster primary

name.title: Primary cluster name
name.description: Choose the cluster name for multi-cluster primary

ingressURL.title: Primary cluster dashboard URL
ingressURL.description: Choose the dashboard URL for the multi-cluster primary; e.g. https://cluster-name.domain/k10

create.title: Enable Prometheus rbac. Warning - cluster wide permissions
create.description: Choose whether to create Prometheus RBAC configuration. Warning: Enabling this action will allow Prometheus permission to scrape Pods in all K8s namespaces.

enabled.title: Enable Prometheus server
enabled.description: Create Prometheus server

storageClass.title: StorageClassName used to create Prometheus PVC
storageClass.description: Setting this option overwrites global StorageClass value

size.title: Volume Size
size.description: Size of embedded Prometheus server volume for storing Veeam Kasten metrics

fullnameOverride.title: Prometheus server deployment name
fullnameOverride.description: Override default Prometheus server deployment name

baseURL.title: Prometheus external url path
baseURL.description: Prometheus external url path at which the server can be accessed

prefixURL.title: Prometheus prefix slug
prefixURL.description: Prometheus prefix slug at which the server can be accessed

enabled.title: Enable Jaeger tracing
enabled.description: Set true to enable Jaeger tracing

externalPort.title: externalPort for K10 services
externalPort.description: Override default 8000 externalPort for K10 services

internalPort.title: internalPort for K10 services
internalPort.description: Override default 8000 internalPort for K10 services

aggregatedApiPort.title: aggregatedApiPort for aggapi service
aggregatedApiPort.description: Override default 10250 port for aggapi service

awsAccessKeyId.title: AWS access key ID
awsAccessKeyId.description: Set AWS access key ID required for AWS deployment

awsIamRole.title: AWS IAM Role
awsIamRole.description: ARN of the AWS IAM role assumed by K10 to perform any AWS operation

awsClientSecretName.title: Secret with AWS credentials and/or IAM Role
awsClientSecretName.description: Specify a Secret directly instead of having to provide awsAccessKeyId, awsSecretAccessKey and awsIamRole

googleApiKey.title: Google API Key
googleApiKey.description: Non-default base64 encoded GCP Service Account key

googleProjectId.title: Google Project ID
googleProjectId.description: Set Google Project ID other than the one in the GCP Service Account

googleClientSecretName.title: Secret with Google credentials
googleClientSecretName.description: Specify a Secret directly instead of having to provide googleApiKey and googleProjectId

tlsSecret.title: K8s TLS secret name contains for k10 Gateway service
tlsSecret.description: Specify a Secret directly instead of having to provide both the cert and key. This reduces the security risk a bit by not caching the certs and keys in the bash history.

dockerConfig.title: Docker config
dockerConfig.description: base64 representation of your Docker credentials to pull docker images from a private registry

dockerConfigPath.title: Docker config path
dockerConfigPath.description: Path to Docker config file to create secret from

azureTenantId.title: Azure tenant ID
azureTenantId.description: Azure tenant ID required for Azure deployment

azureClientSecretName.title: Secret with Azure credentials
azureClientSecretName.description: Specify a Secret directly instead of having to provide azureClientId, azureTenantId and azureClientSecret

azureResourceGroup.title: Azure resource group
azureResourceGroup.description: Resource Group name that was created for the Kubernetes cluster

azureSubscriptionID.title: Azure subscription ID
azureSubscriptionID.description: Subscription ID in your Azure tenant

azureResourceMgrEndpoint.title: Azure resource manager endpoint
azureResourceMgrEndpoint.description: Resource management endpoint for the Azure Stack instance

azureADResourceID.title: Azure Active Directory resource ID
azureADResourceID.description: Azure Active Directory resource ID to obtain AD tokens

microsoftEntraIDResourceID.title: Microsoft Entra ID resource ID
microsoftEntraIDResourceID.description: Microsoft Entra ID resource ID to obtain AD tokens

vsphereClientSecretName.title: Secret with vSphere credentials
vsphereClientSecretName.description: Specify a Secret directly instead of having to provide vsphereUsername, vspherePassword and vspherePassword

consumerId.title: Consumer ID
consumerId.description: Consumer ID in the format project:<project_id>

awsMarketplace.title: AWS Marketplace
awsMarketplace.description: Set AWS cloud metering license mode

redhatMarketplacePayg.title: Red Hat cloud metering
redhatMarketplacePayg.description: Set Red Hat cloud metering license mode

promoID.title: K10 promotion ID
promoID.description: K10 promotion ID from marketing campaigns

clusterName.title: Cluster name
clusterName.description: Cluster name for better logs visibility

externalGateway.title: External gateway
externalGateway.description: Configure external gateway for K10 API services

fqdn.title: Host and domain name for the K10 API services
fqdn.description: Configure host and domain name for the K10 API services

name.title: Domain name for the K10 API services
name.description: Domain name for the K10 API services

type.title: Gateway type
type.description: Supported gateway type: route53-mapper or external-dns

awsSSLCertARN.title: AWS SSL Cert ARN
awsSSLCertARN.description: ARN for the AWS ACM SSL certificate used in the K10 API server

groupAllowList.title: List of groups allowed to access K10 dashboard
groupAllowList.description: A list of groups whose members are allowed access to K10's dashboard

basicAuth.title: Basic authentication for the K10 dashboard
basicAuth.description: Configure basic authentication for the K10 dashboard

enabled.description: Enables basic authentication to the K10 dashboard that allows users to login with username and password

secretName.title: Secret with basic auth creds
secretName.description: Name of an existing Secret that contains a file generated with htpasswd

htpasswd.title: Basic authentication creds
htpasswd.description: A username and password pair separated by a colon character

tokenAuth.title: Token based authentication
tokenAuth.description: Configuration for Token based authentication for the K10 dashboard

enabled.description: Enable token based authentication to access K10 dashboard

oidcAuth.title: Open ID Connect based authentication
oidcAuth.description: Configuration for Open ID Connect based authentication for the K10 dashboard

enabled.title: Enable Open ID Connect based authentication
enabled.description: Enable Open ID Connect based authentication to access K10 dashboard

redirectURL.title: K10 gateway service URL
redirectURL.description: URL to the K10 gateway service

scopes.title: OIDC scopes
scopes.description: Space separated OIDC scopes required for userinfo

prompt.title: OIDC prompt type
prompt.description: The type of prompt to be used during authentication

clientID.title: OIDC client ID
clientID.description: Client ID given by the OIDC provider

clientSecret.title: OIDC client secret
clientSecret.description: Client secret given by the OIDC provider

clientSecretName.title: Reference to secret
clientSecretName.description: Secret containing OIDC client ID and OIDC client secret

usernameClaim.title: OIDC username claim
usernameClaim.description: The claim to be used as the username

usernamePrefix.title: OIDC username prefix

groupClaim.title: OIDC group claim

groupPrefix.title: OIDC group prefix
groupPrefix.description: All groups will be prefixed with this value to prevent conflicts

logoutURL.title: OIDC logout endpoint
logoutURL.description: URL to your OIDC provider's logout endpoint

secretName.title: OIDC config based existing secret
secretName.description: Must include providerURL, redirectURL, scopes, clientID/secret and logoutURL

sessionDuration.title: OIDC session duration
sessionDuration.description: Maximum OIDC session duration. Default value is 1 hour

refreshTokenSupport.title: OIDC Refresh Token support
refreshTokenSupport.description: Enable OIDC Refresh Token support. Disabled by default.

openshift.title: OpenShift OAuth server based authentication
openshift.description: OpenShift OAuth server based authentication for K10 dashboard

enabled.title: Enable OpenShift OAuth server based authentication
enabled.description: Enable OpenShift OAuth server based authentication to access K10 dashboard

serviceAccount.title: Service account that represents an OAuth client
serviceAccount.description: Name of the service account that represents an OAuth client

clientSecret.title: Service account token
clientSecret.description: The token corresponding to the service account

clientSecretName.title: Service account token secret
clientSecretName.description: The secret that contains the token corresponding to the service account

dashboardURL.title: K10 dashboard URL
dashboardURL.description: The URL used for accessing K10's dashboard

openshiftURL.title: OpenShift URL
openshiftURL.description: The URL for accessing OpenShift's API server

insecureCA.title: Disable SSL verification of connections to OpenShift
insecureCA.description: Set true to turn off SSL verification of connections to OpenShift

useServiceAccountCA.title: use the CA certificate corresponding to the Service Account

secretName.title: The Kubernetes Secret that contains OIDC settings
secretName.description: Specify Kubernetes Secret that contains OIDC settings

usernameClaim.title: Username claim
usernameClaim.description: The claim to be used as the username

usernamePrefix.title: Username prefix
usernamePrefix.description: Prefix that has to be used with the username obtained from the username claim

groupnameClaim.title: custom OpenID Connect claim name for specifying user groups
groupnameClaim.description: Name of a custom OpenID Connect claim for specifying user groups

caCertsAutoExtraction.title: Enable the OCP CA certificates automatic extraction
caCertsAutoExtraction.description: Enable the OCP CA certificates automatic extraction to the K10 namespace

ldap.title: Active Directory/LDAP based authentication
ldap.description: Active Directory/LDAP based authentication for the K10 dashboard

enabled.title: Enable Active Directory/LDAP based authentication
enabled.description: Enable Active Directory/LDAP based authentication to access K10 dashboard

restartPod.title: force a restart of the authentication service Pod
restartPod.description: force a restart of the authentication service Pod (useful when updating authentication config)

dashboardURL.title: K10 dashboard URL
dashboardURL.description: The URL used for accessing K10's dashboard

host.title: Host and port of the AD/LDAP server
host.description: Host and optional port of the AD/LDAP server in the form `host:port`

insecureNoSSL.title: Insecure AD/LDAP host
insecureNoSSL.description: Set if the AD/LDAP host is not using TLS

insecureSkipVerifySSL.title: Skip SSL verification of connections to the AD/LDAP host
insecureSkipVerifySSL.description: Turn off SSL verification of connections to the AD/LDAP host

startTLS.title: TLS protocol
startTLS.description: When set to true, ldap:// is used to connect to the server followed by creation of a TLS session. When set to false, ldaps:// is used.

bindDN.title: Username for connecting to the AD/LDAP host
bindDN.description: The Distinguished Name(username) used for connecting to the AD/LDAP host

bindPW.title: The password for `bindDN`
bindPW.description: The password corresponding to the `bindDN` for connecting to the AD/LDAP host

bindPWSecretName.title: Secret name containing the password
bindPWSecretName.description: Secret name containing the password corresponding to the `bindDN` for connecting to the AD/LDAP host

baseDN.title: The base username to start the AD/LDAP search from
baseDN.description: The base Distinguished Name to start the AD/LDAP search from

filter.title: filter to apply when searching
filter.description: Optional filter to apply when searching the directory

username.title: Username to search in the directory
username.description: Attribute used for comparing user entries when searching the directory

idAttr.title: Attribute in a user's entry that should map to the user ID field in a token
idAttr.description: AD/LDAP attribute in a user's entry that should map to the user ID field in a token

emailAttr.title: Attribute in a user's entry that should map to the email field in a token
emailAttr.description: AD/LDAP attribute in a user's entry that should map to the email field in a token

nameAttr.title: Attribute in a user's entry that should map to the name field in a token
nameAttr.description: Attribute in a user's entry that should map to the name field in a token

preferredUsernameAttr.title: Attribute in a user's entry that should map to the preferred_username field in a token
preferredUsernameAttr.description: AD/LDAP attribute in a user's entry that should map to the preferred_username field in a token

baseDN.title: The base Distinguished Name
baseDN.description: The base Distinguished Name to start the AD/LDAP group search from

filter.title: Search filter
filter.description: filter to apply when searching the directory for groups

userAttr.title: Attribute in the user's entry
userAttr.description: Attribute in the user's entry that must match the groupAttr when searching for groups

groupAttr.title: Attribute in the group's entry
groupAttr.description: Attribute in the group's entry that must match the userAttr when searching for groups

userMatchers.title: List of field pairs that are used to match a user to a group
userMatchers.description: List of field pairs that are used to match a user to a group

nameAttr.title: Attribute that represents a group's name in the directory
nameAttr.description: The AD/LDAP attribute that represents a group's name in the directory

secretName.title: The Kubernetes Secret with OIDC settings
secretName.description: The Kubernetes Secret that contains OIDC settings

usernameClaim.title: Username claim

jobWait.title: Specifies the timeout (in minutes) for completing execution of any child job, after which the parent job will be canceled
jobWait.description: Specifies the timeout (in minutes) for completing execution of any child job, after which the parent job will be canceled. If no value is set, a default of 10 hours will be used

assumeRoleDuration.title: Duration of a session token generated by AWS for an IAM role
assumeRoleDuration.description: The minimum value is 15 minutes, and the maximum value is determined by the maximum session duration setting for that IAM role. For documentation on how to view and edit the maximum session duration for an IAM role, refer to https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/id_roles_use.html#id_roles_use_view-role-max-session. The value accepts a number followed by a single character, 'm' (for minutes) or 'h' (for hours). Examples include: 60m or 2h

efsBackupVaultName.description: Set the AWS EFS backup vault name

ephemeralPVCOverhead.title: Storage overhead for ephemeral PVCs
ephemeralPVCOverhead.description: Set the percentage increase for the ephemeral Persistent Volume Claim's storage request, e.g. pvc size = (file raw size) * (1 + `ephemeralPVCOverhead`)

enabled.description: Enables K10 Quick Disaster Recovery feature, with ability to restore necessary K10 resources and exported restore points of applications.
enabled.title: Enable K10 Quick Disaster Recovery.

restoreTimeout.title: Restore timeout
restoreTimeout.description: Sets the maximum duration (in minutes) for a restore operation to complete

enabled.description: Enables K10 FIPS (Federal Information Processing Standard) mode of operation.

Enable ActionPodSpec and ActionPodSpecBinding CRDs
enabled.description: Enables the use of ActionPodSpec and ActionPodSpecBinding for granular resource configuration of temporary Pods associated with Kasten Actions

resourcesRequests.title: Maximum resource requests
resourcesRequests.description: Specifies the cluster-wide, maximum values for resource requests which may be used in any ActionPodSpec

maxMemory.description: Specifies the cluster-wide, maximum value for memory resource requests which may be used in any ActionPodSpec

maxCPU.title: Maximum cpu request
maxCPU.description: Specifies the cluster-wide, maximum value for CPU resource requests which may be used in any ActionPodSpec

maxEphemeralStorage.title: Maximum storage allocation
maxEphemeralStorage.description: Specifies the cluster-wide maximum value for storage volumes that may be attached to any ActionPodSpec

defaultActionPodSpec.title: Default ActionPodSpec name
defaultActionPodSpec.description: The name of ActionPodSpec that will be used by default for worker Pod resources. if empty, the default APS is omitted

frs.title: File recovery session
frs.description: Limits for the file recovery session feature

maxMountsPerSession.title: Maximum volume mounts per session
maxMountsPerSession.description: Sets the maximum number of volume mounts permitted in a single file recovery session

maxMountsPerNamespace.title: Maximum volume mounts per namespace
maxMountsPerNamespace.description: Sets the maximum number of volume mounts permitted across all file recovery sessions in a single namespace

maxSystemMounts.title: Maximum volume mounts in the cluster
maxSystemMounts.description: Sets the maximum number of volume mounts permitted accross all file recovery sessions systemwide
